eady familiar with JUnit. You can find it here:

That introduction is quite n=
ice. I am looking forward being able to use
JUnit 4.

Just one question:

s=
ince there is no longer any static dependencies with Junit TestCase,
should=
 the tests be written in the class to be tested or in another
class?

I was=
 used to create a test source folder with all my tests cases.

Using annota=
tions, I would prefer declaring the tests directly inside my
class.

Any hi=
nts about that?
